greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 0; for n > 0, a(n) = final nonzero number in the sequence n, f(n,2), f(f(n,2),3), f(f(f(n,2),3),4),..., where f(n,d)=Floor(n/F(d+1)), with F denoting the Fibonacci numbers (A000045).
comment: Records in {a(n)} are given in A099565.

a(n) gives the most significant digit of n when written in "base A003266", like A099563 and A276153 give the most significant digit in bases A000142 and A002110 respectively. - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 23 2016
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3120
program: (define (A099564 n) (let loop ((n n) (i 3)) (let* ((f (A000045 i)) (dig (modulo n f)) (next-n (/ (- n dig) f))) (if (zero? next-n) dig (loop next-n (+ 1 i))))))
(define (A099564 n) (let loop ((n n) (f1 1) (f2 2)) (let* ((dig (modulo n f2)) (next-n (/ (- n dig) f2))) (if (zero? next-n) dig (loop next-n f2 (+ f1 f2))))))
xref: Cf. A000045, A003266, A099565 (positions of records).
Differs from A099563 for the first time at n=24.
Differs from A276153 for the first time at n=210, where a(210)=7, while A276153(210)=1.
results.author: _John W. Layman_, Oct 22 2004
ext: a(0) = 0 prepended and the name corrected by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 23 2016
